revised_title: Electrically Driven Jets: A Study of Fluid Dynamics and Electrostatics
tldr: This article explores the behavior of electrically driven jets of conducting fluids and their stability under varying electric fields. The author, Sir Geoffrey Taylor, investigates the forces at play and the mechanics of these jets, providing insights into the relationship between electric fields and fluid dynamics. The study has implications for understanding the behavior of water jets and the stability of thin fluid films under electric fields.
